summary: King William Island, also known as ÃŽle du Roi-Guillaume or Qikiqtaq, is located in Nunavut, Canada. It's around 5,000 square miles in size, making it the world's 61st largest island. The island is home to just one community, Gjoa Haven, with a population of 1,349 people. Many polar explorers visited the island while searching for the Northwest Passage.
title: King William Island
